content: these mittens fail terribly at warming your hands but look fabulous on your christmas tree they are knit in the round in one piece on dpns and because they only have 6 rounds they take minutes to make i especially like their bobble thumbs i used worsted but for even tinier mittens you could use fingering or sock enjoy and stay warm if you like this pattern you may also like my mini boots and stockings 2 hope you enjoy this free pattern happy knitting natasha > **praise for mini mittens** > > another fun quick knit took only > about 15 minutes the bobble thumb is > genius charlenekirkland 3 > > my christmas elf had cold hands > solution this adorable free pattern > courtesy natasha hanson > fashionistaknit 5 > > another fun quick knit thank you > natasha mirihi 4 > > cute little mittens fliwatut 6 > > thank you for this tiny sweet pattern > i attached them with a crocheted cord > because my yarn is not twisted fun > and fast to make wedina 7 1 https //www ravelry com/bundles/winter-1284 2 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/mini-boots-and-stockings 3 https //www ravelry com/projects/charlenekirkland/blue-mini-mitten 4 https //www ravelry com/projects/mirihi/mini-mittens 5 https //www ravelry com/projects/fashionistaknit/mini-mittens 6 https //www ravelry com/projects/fliwatut/mini-mittens-testknit-2 7 https //www ravelry com/projects/wedina/mittens
